ARABIC: إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَأْتِ رَبَّهُۥ مُجْرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As for those who come to their Lord as evildoers, they will have Hell where they will neither die nor stay alive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely for him who comes before his Lord a sinner shall be Hell, where he will neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The truth is that Hell awaits him who comes to his Lord laden with sin; he shall neither die in it nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The dwelling place of one who comes into the presence of his Lord as a criminal will be hell wherein he will never die nor enjoy his life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the one who comes guilty to his Lord – so undoubtedly for him is hell; neither dying nor living in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal, then surely, for him is Hell, wherein he will neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Whoever comes to his Lord (being) guilty, for him is surely hell; he shall not die therein, nor shall he live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Whosoever comes unto his Lord a sinner, for him awaits Gehenna wherein he shall neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell. There he will neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Indeed, he who comes to his Lord a sinner shall be consigned to Hell; he shall neither die therein nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily whosoever cometh unto his lord as a Culprit, for him is Hell wherein he will neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Whoever comes to his Lord laden with guilt, for him shall be hell, where he will neither live nor die.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at Judgment),- for him is Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! Whoever comes to his Lord as a Mujrim (criminal, polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah and His Messengers, sinner, etc.), then surely, for him is Hell, therein he will neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Gehenna (Hell) awaits whosoever comes before his Lord as a sinner, there he shall neither die nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Whoever comes to his Lord guilty, for him is Hell, where he neither dies nor lives.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:74] God, exalted be He, says: Truly whoever comes to his Lord a criminal, a disbeliever, like Pharaoh, for him there shall be Hell wherein he shall neither die, and thus find rest, nor live, a life of any benefit to him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! whoso cometh) on the Day of Judgement (guilty) an idolater (unto his Lord, verily for him is hell. There he will neither die) such that he finds rest (nor live) a beneficial life.
